About Newmont

Newmont is the world's leading gold company and a producer of copper, silver, zinc, lead and molybdenum. The company's world-class portfolio of assets, prospects and talent is anchored in favourable mining jurisdictions in Australia, Papua New Guinea, Africa, Latin America and the Caribbean and North America.

Newmont is the only gold producer listed in the S&P 500 Index and is widely recognized for its principled environmental, social and governance practices. The company is an industry leader in value creation, supported by robust safety standards, superior execution and technical proficiency. Newmont was founded in 1921 and has been publicly traded since 1925. Newmont's APAC operations are in Western Australia, the Northern Territory, New South Wales and Papua New Guinea and Business Unit support is provided from our offices in Brisbane, Perth and Melbourne.

Your impact

Reporting to the Director, Business Improvement, in the newly created position of Specialist, Business Improvement, you will be an integral contributor to the execution and delivery of Newmont's reshaping global business improvement strategy at a site-based, operational level for the Tanami Operations.

The primary purpose of your role will be to enhance site productivity outcomes by recommending improvements through the analysis, program management and delivery of data insights into business improvement initiatives at site level.

As part of our team you will

Collaborate with site and project teams on the execution of business improvement initiatives and guide performance metrics definition and monitoring of productivity impacts
Review data analytics and insights to ensure business improvement initiative outcomes are measured and monitored
Identify internal and external benchmarks for productivity improvements and monitor site performance against these benchmarks
Create reports and distribute information on improvement metrics
Conduct training sessions on process improvements based upon data analysis
Create and deliver presentations on improvement project impacts and learnings
Adhere to global business improvement standards and ensure operating procedures are maintained at site level

Prerequisites for your success in the role

Degree qualification in Engineering (Mining, Mechanical, Metallurgy or related) preferrerd
Experience in mine operations and understanding of mining processes - i.e. drill and blast
Knowledge of continuous improvement methods - i.e. Lean, Six Sigma, Theory of Constraints
Understanding of change management application in an operational environment
Problem solving, value stream mapping and workshop facilitation experience
Well-developed safety awareness including risk and compliance in improvement initiatives
Operational productivity data analysis skills with ability to identify gaps for improvement
Ability to create visualisation dashboards and presentations that reflect data driven insights
Project delivery experience with skills in performance tracking against KPI's
Skills in ERP and operational data systems - i.e. SAP
Proficient data analysis skills and use of visualisation tools - i.e. Excel and Power BI
Knowledge of SQL and/or scripting preferred
Full and unrestricted eligibility to work in Australia

Your work environment

Newmont has fully owned and operated the Tanami mine since 2002. The mine operates in the remote Tanami Desert of Australia. The mine and plant are located on Aboriginal freehold land that is owned by the Warlpiri people and managed on their behalf by the Central Desert Aboriginal Lands Trust. Tanami is a fly-in-fly-out operation in one of Australia's most remote locations. Tanami is 270 km from its closest neighbours, the remote Aboriginal community of Yuendumu.

This permanent position will be based on-site at the Tanami Mine Operation in the remote Northern Territory working on a fly in, fly out flexible roster (8:6) from Perth, Darwin, Brisbane or Alice Springs.

Full and unrestricted eligibility for employment in Australia will be essential.

Public Skills Australia has been appointed by the Department of Employment and Workplace Relations (DEWR) as one of 10 Jobs and Skills Councils. A primary function of our work is to provide workforce planning, industry intelligence and training product development in support of industry needs and government priorities.

The Manager Workforce Planning and Insights is accountable to the Director Workforce Strategy and Insights and delivers the Public Skills Australia’s Workforce Planning and Research functions. The Manager Workforce Planning and Insights is part of the management team and will oversee the day-to-day management of the Workforce Planning and Insights team. This position will be accountable for the end-to-end planning, management and delivery of successful projects, including reporting, monitoring, and tracking deliverables and milestones and managing budgets and associated risks. While this position reports to the Director they may be required to report to other executive staff depending on the projects they need to manage.

Workforce Planning: This role will lead the development and delivery of annual Workforce Insights Reports by managing a small team of staff dedicated to these deliverables. The delivery of the Workforce Insights Reports required robust desktop and applied research, quantitative analysis of national and industry datasets, qualitative research methods to draw out industry insights and comprehensive consultation of data and findings. The Manager, Workforce Planning and Insights will be responsible for the overarching team planning and project planning to ensure all milestones are met. The Workforce Planning function also requires comprehensive written capability to draft and review extensive reports.

Research: The Manager Workforce Planning and Insights will also oversee a small team of staff dedicated to producing individual research projects that give effect to workforce strategies, ministerial priorities, industry sector requirements and Board directives. This position will oversee the management of a range of project involving analysis of qualitative and quantitative data to deliver research and other project deliverables. They will lead a small team, develop a workplan to deliver projects on the annual Public Skills Australia Business Plan, manage and contract subcontractors, manage their budget and ensure robust consultation, good governance and adherence to federal government requirements.
